intro: Austroblechnum integrifrons, commonly known as the New Zealand tree fern, is a species of tree fern native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Blechnaceae and is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and large, feather-like fronds. The plant thrives in humid, shaded environments, typically found in forests and along stream banks. Its fronds are typically bright green and can reach lengths of up to 3 meters. Austroblechnum integrifrons plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing shelter and food for various wildlife species.
